entry.title: Comunidade Unida e Reunida - Meetup Virtual
entry.content:
Ontem realizamos mais uma etapa virtual com a comunidade SAP em Recife. O SAP Meetup Virtual um encontro rico, onde tivemos a oportunidade de conversar sobre tudo o que vem acontecendo no nosso ecossistema local, as transformações que estão surgindo e também discutir grandes ideias para o futuro.

Participantes: Cláudia, @afigueredo54 , @phfranca , @RobertaFernande, Wilma Xavier e @Marssel700 

Encerramos a sessão com uma ótima notícia: já temos a data definida para o SAP Inside Track Recife 2026 (23/05/2026).

Fiquem atentos, em breve teremos mais informações e contamos com a participação de todos para fazer desse evento um marco ainda maior para a comunidade!

entry.title: My expert playlist, SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 and TechEd Virtual
entry.content:
TechEd is just around the corner, and I’m already excited! Here are some of the sessions I’m most looking forward to this year:😀

 

📌DA207v | Planning and analytics: Innovations powering SAP Business Data Cloud with the speaker : Jie Deng and Maximilian Paul GanderLearn how SAP Business Data Cloud is shaping the future of planning and analytics.

📌Boosting business efficiency with AI innovations in document processing with the speaker :  Tomasz janasz and   Tobias weller See how AI accelerates document-heavy business processes and improves productivity.


📌AI100v | Build custom AI solutions with the generative AI hub with the speaker : Andreas KergerDiscover how to create tailored AI use cases with the Generative AI Hub.


📌CT1247 | Advanced deep learning techniques in SAP AI Core on SAP BTP with the speaker : Juhi Kulshreshtha Dive deeper into cutting-edge AI with advanced deep learning on BTP.


📌CT1252 | Open source extends ABAP Cloud with the speaker : Björn Schulz 

Explore how open-source innovation enhances the ABAP Cloud ecosystem.
📌CT1261 | How to secure your instances of SAP HANA Cloud  with the speaker : Anna Hartmann Get practical insights on securing SAP HANA Cloud for enterprise use.


📌PAR107 | SAP and Databricks: Real-time insights and AI without ETL  with the speaker : Akram Chetibi  Learn how SAP and Databricks deliver insights without complex ETL pipelines.

and don't miss my session 😉  CT1245 | Hugging Face Transformers in AI Foundation 

👉Not registered yet? Sign up here: SAP TechEd
👉Stay connected with the community: SAP TechEd Group

i would love to know which sessions are on your playlist and you in Berlin! 🤗

SAP TechEd

entry.title: Step-by-Step Guide to Creating a SOAP API in SAP S/4HANA and Configuring It Using SOAMANAGER
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,
In this blog post, I will walk you through the process of creating a SOAP-based web service in SAP S/4HANA, and demonstrate how to configure and expose it using SOAMANAGER for consumption by external systems.

What is SOAP API ?

SOAP API stands for Simple Object Access Protocol.

It is a protocol-based method of communication that allows different systems to exchange data over a network — usually using XML messages over HTTP or HTTPS.

Difference Between SOAP API and Rest API

Feature / Aspect          SOAP API (in SAP)                                    REST API (in SAP)

TechnologyWeb Service (Enterprise Service, Function Module via SOAMANAGER)OData service via SAP Gateway (or RAP in S/4HANA)
Tool UsedSPROXY,SOAMANAGER, SE37SAP Gateway, SEGW, CDS Views, RAP Model.
Data FormatXML onlyMostly JSON (also supports XML)
Typical Use CaseIntegration with legacy systems, middleware, PI/POFiori apps, mobile apps, third-party REST integrations
SecurityWS-Security, SAML, SSLHTTPS, OAuth 2.0, SAML
PerformanceHeavier (due to XML parsing and SOAP envelope)Faster and lighter (especially with JSON)
Contract DescriptionWSDL file.$metadata (EDMX format) via OData.
Preferred InECC or S/4 for BAPIs, ALE, PI/PO scenarios.S/4HANA, Fiori Elements, RESTful integrations.


Step 1:Create a Structure & Table Type for Request and Response.

Objects with the naming convention ZCH* are designed to be transported across all systems (DEV → QA → PROD).

In contrast, objects with the naming convention YCH* are typically created only for development purposes and are stored in the $TMP package, meaning they are local objects and will not be transported. These may be deleted later.

YCH_CUST_REQ is the request structure.



We need to save in $TMP.

YCH_CUST_REQ_TT is the table type which is consuming YCH_CUST_REQ structure

We are storing the request table type in $TMP

YCH_CUST_RES_S is the Response Payload and stored in the $tmp package




Table type YCH_CUST_RES_TT is the table type & it is consuming YCH_CUST_RES_S and stored in $TMP package.

 

Step2) Creating RFC FM and saved in $TMP Package

So here we are declaring IM_REQUEST as Import parameter with type of Table Type of Request (YCH_CUST_REQ_TT)


So here we are declaring EX_RESPONSE as Export parameter with type of Table Type of Request (YCH_CUST_RES_TT)

There will be no logic written inside the function module only Importing and exporting parameter will be defined

Step 3)Creation of Web service

We need to go for Utilities ->More Utilities->Create web service->From the function Module.

Provide the service definition name and Description

By Default it will take Function module name

By Default it will assign SOAP Appl & Profile


Click on local object check box so that by default it will be assigned to $TMP package

Click on finish to create web service

What is WSDL ?
It is an XML-based language used to describe web services and how to access them. Think of it as a contract between the service provider and the consumer, detailing what the service does, where it can be accessed, and how to interact with it.

Once after that go to WSDL tab and Click on export symbol and download the data in Notepad

So in the WSDL file change the filed type from "tns:char10" to "xsd: String" as below in the downloaded Notepad from WSDL tab.

 


Step 4) Go to Sproxy tcode

Click on New icon to create Service Consumer.

Select the service Consumer radio button


Select External/WSDL schema.

Chose local file

Choose the local file path for the WSDL.

Provide the package with workbench task request & provide the prefix so that we will taken as reference to create a SOAP class.

click on finish

Save the Service Consumer YSRV_SRV_DEF


Change the Release status from Not Released to Released state and Activate the Service Consumer.

So in the External View Tab we can see all Request and Response Fields.



Soap Class ZCH_CL_CO_YSRV_SRV_DEF will be generated automatically which is helpful in sending and receiving the data using the method YCUST_SOAP_API



Step 5) Execute SOAMANAGER Tcode.

An web page will be opened 

Select Web service Configuration

Search our proxy(YSRV_SRV_DEF) in Object type as showed below

We will get the SOAP Class click on that & go for Create -> Manual Configuration

Provide the Logical Port name & description. Click on next

So in Consumer Security Provide the User Id & Password that will be Provided from CPI team (Middleware/Integration Team).

Assign the Endpoint URL which will be Provided from CPI team (Middleware/Integration Team). which will be linked to CPI system.

Change the Message ID protocol to Suppress ID transfer and click on finish.

Once after finishing the soamanger configuration click on the below highlighted icon for Ping the web service.

By pinging the SOAMANGER web service we can Validate our Endpoint, Username & Password.

If it's Successful then we will get the result as below else we will get error.



Step 6)Create a report program that consumes a SOAP API to send and receive data.

REPORT zcv_r_soap_api.
DATA:ls_req TYPE zch_cl_soap_ycust_soap_api,   
     ls_res TYPE  zch_cl_soap_ycust_soap_apiresp.

SELECT FROM kna1 FIELDS kunnr,name1 INTO TABLE (gt_cust).

LOOP AT gt_cust INTO DATA(ls_cust).
  APPEND VALUE zch_cl_ych_cust_req( customer = ls_cust-kunnr name = ls_cust-name1 ) TO ls_req-im_request-item.
ENDLOOP.

DATA(go_ref)  = NEW zch_cl_co_ysrv_srv_def( ).
TRY.
    go_ref->ycust_soap_api(
      EXPORTING
        input  = ls_req
      IMPORTING
        output = ls_res
    ).
  CATCH cx_ai_system_fault INTO DATA(ls_error). " Communication Error
    MESSAGE ls_error->get_text( ) TYPE 'E'.
    ENDTRY.

In the  above report program, ZCH_CL_SOAP_YCUST_SOAP_API and ZCH_CL_SOAP_YCUST_SOAP_APIRESP are automatically generated structures from the proxy class ZCH_CL_CO_YSRV_SRV_DEF, and are defined as the exporting and importing parameters, respectively, for the method YCUST_SOAP_API.

In the report, I am using the statement APPEND VALUE ZCH_CL_YCH_CUST_REQ at line 8. Here, ZCH_CL_YCH_CUST_REQ is a deep structure that is part of the structure ZCH_CL_SOAP_YCUST_SOAP_API, which was generated by the proxy class.

Later, we created an object of the class ZCH_CL_CO_YSRV_SRV_DEF, through which we called the method YCUST_SOAP_API. The request data is passed in the structure ls_req, and the response is received in the structure ls_res.

Any errors related to the proxy call will be handled in the CATCH block using ABAP's TRY...CATCH exception handling mechanism.

entry.title: #sitMUC25 - Registration is now open!
entry.content:
After the long wait, registration for sitMUC 2025 is finally open!

 On Saturday, October 11th, we will meet in Garching, Munich for the #sitMUC25.
A full day of sharing knowledge, exchanging ideas, and connecting across all areas of SAP.
Seats are limited, so don’t wait too long to secure your spot 😉.

Here’s how you can join the full #sitMUC25 experience

  • Main Event sitMUC | Saturday, Oct 11th
    SAP Inside Track Munich 10th edition

  • Pre-Evening | Friday, Oct 10th
    a relaxed get-together to start the weekend.

  • Post-Evening | Saturday, Oct 11th
    community time after the sessions in Garchinger Augustiner.

  • SAP Code Jam | Friday, Oct 10th, 10:00–16:00
    separate registration required
    Topic: Service integration with the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model

Please note: sitMUC is an on-site event, physical participation is required.

We’re looking forward to seeing you in Munich. Let’s make #sitMUC25 another inspiring community weekend together!
Got any questions? Feel free to post them here in the comments, we’re happy to help!

entry.title: New Intelligent Search Available in Beta Phase
entry.content:
If you take a close look at the search field available throughout SAP Community, you’ll notice a new option in the pulldown: Beta Search. This search introduces several new filtering options, including the ability to filter by SAP Managed Tag and by question status such as unanswered questions (one of the most requested features from members!). 

Powered by Coveo, this new federated search pulls from multiple repositories, not just SAP Community. In fact, this new search will also be available on other SAP sites – including SAP.com, SAP Store, and SAP Support Portal – with a consistent UI and design, creating a better user experience as visitors navigate across SAP’s various online destinations. 

You can narrow your search down to specific sites from the top tabs – selecting Products, Community, or Support – but if you want hits from various platforms, you can refine via the All Results tab. From there, you can click several options under the Document Type dropdown. For example, in addition to the standard options that you would expect for SAP Community (such as Question, Discussion, and Blog Post), you can choose Learning Journey, SAP Knowledge Base Article, and News and Press. 

That’s a small sample of what’s available. Looking for training content from SAP Developer Center? Click the Tutorial box. Need material from SAP Help Portal? Select Product Documentation. There’s even a Video option if you’re looking for media from SAP channels on YouTube.  

Additional options will allow you to find products directly on the SAP Store site. Depending on the search topic, you may even get an AI-generated answer – although the beta results will require additional learning and refinement.  

While the results above may not be completely accurate, all of this search will get smarter over time – thanks to you. Coveo relies on a machine-learning model that reacts to user behavior, so your activity will play an important role in improving search outcomes. 

And speaking of outcomes – as an SAP Community member, you’re likely interested in what the search outcomes mean for users trying to find information on our site. We encourage you to test the beta search and see for yourself. You’ll notice some options remain the same, compared to the platform’s current search – such as filtering by date – whereas options for searching for users and authors are gone - but will come back with later phases of the search project.

You’ll also find a few new dropdowns, including menus for filtering SAP Community results by specific products and SAP Managed Tags. You can select multiple options from recommendations or search available products and tags to fine-tune results. 

Perhaps most importantly, you’ll be able to filter questions by status (answered, solved, and open), meeting one of the biggest demands from members looking to find (or provide) solutions to problems. 

During the beta phase, you’ll still be able to use the normal SAP Community site search. Results for the beta search will only pull public content – meaning you won’t be able to use it to find information from any private groups (if you belong to any).  

We expect the beta phase to run through the rest of 2025 – possibly into the middle of 2026. We’ll provide updates about future phases in What’s New as they become available. 

Try the new beta search for yourself, compare it to the current search, and leave your questions and observations in the comments below or give feedback via our community inbox community@sap.com. We look forward to your feedback!

entry.title: Business Processes Open Lecture: від теорії до практики з SAP
entry.content:
🎓Learn. Engage. Connect. Get Certified!

Запрошуємо студентів та викладачів ВНЗ на Business Processes Open Lecture 2025/26 — відкритий курс від SAP, який допоможе розібратися, як сучасні компанії керують ключовими бізнес-процесами, і як SAP системи об’єднують фінанси, логістику, закупівлі, продажі та інші напрями в єдине ціле.

📖У програмі:

  • 60 годин навчання (38 годин у власному темпі + 21 інтерактивна онлайн-сесія щочетверга).

  • Доступ до живої системи SAP S/4HANA Cloud для практичних вправ.

  • Поєднання теорії, реальних бізнес-кейсів та роботи з експертами.

  • Можливість отримати офіційну сертифікацію SAP (2 безкоштовні спроби).

Це шанс не лише здобути знання, а й перевірити їх у практиці, поспілкуватися з експертами та однодумцями, а також отримати сертифікат, який підтримає вашу академічну чи професійну кар’єру. 

Перша лекція стартує 30 жовтня.

🚀Приєднуйтесь за посиланням та відкрийте для себе світ SAP бізнес-процесів у форматі, який зручно поєднувати з навчанням чи роботою!

entry.title: Update to our Rules of Engagement
entry.content:
We have updated our Rules of Engagement today.

To explain in short what has changed since the last version: 

  • Article 1 now describes the participation etiquette that we expect all community members to follow, as well as outlines the general rules for content publication. For more in-depth information on the participation etiquette and tips for participation in the community, please read this article in our Welcome Corner group. 
  • Article 2 contains information on user profile. 
  • Article 3 describes content which constitutes "Unacceptable Content". Content that is listed in article 3 may either by rejected or removed. The categories here are now aligned with changes the EU made to the Digital Services Act (DSA) categories this year. All abuse reports under article 3 will be subject to DSA.
  • The old article 3 has been removed, which means publishing content about job opportunities and job postings are no longer permitted in the SAP Community.
  • Article 4 has not changed and remains the same. 

With these updates to our rules of engagement, we continue to ensure the best possible content quality and community experience for our members..

entry.title: Thanks for attending SAP Tech Night at SAP Labs Gurgaon – A Night of Ideas, Inspiration & Community
entry.content:
SAP Tech Night at SAP Labs Gurgaon – A Night of Ideas, Inspiration & Community 🌙💡

Yesterday, we had the privilege of hosting  SAP Community Tech Night at SAP Labs Gurgaon, and what an incredible evening it turned out to be! 

The Flow of the Evening 🌟

✨ A Warm Beginning

The evening began with my welcome to everyone and a brief sharing of the agenda, followed by Jitan Batra and Neeraj Manocha, who painted a vivid picture of the SAP Community journey—from Stammtisch and Tech Nights to Inside Tracks. Their words reminded us that behind every great community lies the spirit of people coming together, sharing, and growing.

⚡ The Future with SAP Joule
I had the opportunity to present SAP Joule—exploring its role for developers, consultants, studios, skills, automation, and agents. What struck me most wasn’t just delivering the session—it was the spark in the room, the curiosity, and the conversations that followed. The future of work with Joule feels closer than ever.

🤖 AI Transforming Support
Nirjar Gandhi then took us on a journey into AI-driven customer support, showcasing tools like Early Watch, Application Conversion Assistant, App Inspector in S/4HANA 2025, and Intelligent Log Analysis. It was one of those sessions that made us realize—AI isn’t a buzzword here, it’s solving real problems today.

🌍 Rise with SAP
Closing the formal sessions, Niharika Razdan spoke about Rise with SAP and how it’s reshaping ERP. Her perspective on the role of SAP Basis consultants sparked important discussions about career growth, transformation, and the opportunities ahead.

🤝 Networking & Next Steps
The networking session was buzzing—people exchanging ideas, making plans, and brainstorming about the upcoming SAP Inside Track Gurgaon on 15-Nov-2025. It was community in action, and it felt powerful.

🍴 Dinner Together
Finally, over dinner, conversations flowed as naturally as the food. Because at the heart of every great community event is not just learning together, but also sharing a meal and building friendships.

Gratitude 🙏

  • To the speakers for making the sessions insightful and inspiring.

  • To the attendees from across SAP, IBM, TCS, Accenture, Capgemini, The Silicon Partner, and more – for bringing your passion and energy.

  • To SAP Labs Gurgaon – for hosting us so warmly.

  • To everyone who supported and organized behind the scenes – you made it all possible.

What’s Next? 🚀

The excitement doesn’t end here. With discussions already underway for the SAP Inside Track Gurgaon, we’re just getting started.

Last night reminded me of this truth: Technology changes fast, but it’s the people, the community, and the shared learning that make the biggest difference. And that’s what SAP Community is all about.

👉 Were you part of SAP Tech Night? Share your favorite highlight or takeaway in the comments—I’d love to hear your perspective!

On behalf of SAP Community NCR

entry.title: SAP TechEd on Tour is Coming to Sydney!
entry.content:
Big news! SAP TechEd on Tour is landing in Sydney this November as part of Mastering SAP Collaborate From 12–14 November 2025, the ICC Sydney will become the ultimate hub for learning, innovation, and connecting with the SAP community.

 

 

 

 

 

Why You Can’t Miss This

This isn’t just another conference. This is where experts meet learners, tech meets business and where the #SAPCommunity comes alive.

Here’s what’s waiting for you:

  • Tracks covering everything from AI & Joule to Data & Analytics, S/4HANA Core, Security & Risk, Finance, Integration, HCM, and more.
  • Practical, hands-on learning you can use to solve business challenges
  • Networking with peers, partners, and SAP leaders who share your challenges (and solutions!)

Developers, This One’s for You

Our SAP Developer Advocates are joining us in Sydney - bringing fresh insights, live demos, and their best tips.

Don’t miss the Developer Garage. Your playground to:

  • Get hands-on with SAP BTP, AI, and App Dev
  • Learn new topics at your own pace
  • Experiment with guidance from SAP experts right beside you

This year is packed with possibilities! You can dive into building AI agents with Joule, unlock real-time insights with SAP Business Data Cloud, accelerate full-stack app development with GenAI, and modernize your integration landscape with SAP Integration Suite.

And that’s not all. SAP Mentors and SAP Champions will also be in the house, sharing their expertise, experiences, and community spirit. A perfect chance to connect with the people who inspire and guide the global SAP ecosystem.

Get the knowledge & then get certified with a 25% savings

Another great reason to be part of this event, is the 25% discount on any SAP Certification exam. Come and explore the most up-to-date official SAP TechEd knowledge and knowhow, and then put it to good use as part of your certification prep. The 25% saving offer is valid to 19 December. More details can be found here.

Be Part of It

If you are in the SAP ecosystem, this is the event. Whether you are a developer, architect, consultant, or business leader - there’s something here for you.

📅 12–14 November 2025
📍 ICC Sydney Exhibition Centre

View the agenda here.

Register here.

entry.title: Introducing a New Badge Progression Set Just for Bloggers
entry.content:
In August, we launched three new badge progression sets that rewarded members for providing solutions to questions, earning kudos, and giving kudos. Now, after a brief badge hiatus, we’re back with a brand-new progression set exclusively for bloggers.

The previous sets built upon existing badges that have been available since we launched the new platform last year. To be specific: Before we rolled out those sets last month, members could earn a badge for their first kudo received, their first kudo given, and their first answer accepted as a solution. So we’ve long encouraged – and commended – those activities. With this new progression set, however, we are returning to recognizing members solely for their blogging.

On our previous SAP Community platform, members could have earned five badges for publishing blog posts: Blogger, Avid Blogger, Skillful Blogger, Master Blogger, and Grand Master Blogger. You may even stumble across these retired badges when you click “View all badges” on the content page of a long-time member. For example:

We haven’t had the equivalent of those blog badges on this platform, but that will change as of Wednesday, September 24 – the day when we bring back a progression set just for blogging.

This blogging set, like the other sets made available in August, will contain five badges in total. We’ll award the first badge to members who published one blog post, the second to those who published two blog posts, the third to those who published five blog posts, the fourth to those who published ten blog posts, and the final badge to those who published thirty.

We plan to award the badges retroactively, so if you’re already an active blogger, you can expect one or more badges tomorrow. If you’d like to know exactly how many you’ll get (if any), you should check your “My content” page to confirm how many blog posts you’ve published. To do that, log in, then select “My content.”

Once you’re on your content page, you’ll notice a gray box at the top. Please ignore it, as the numbers there aren’t related to the blogging badges. (The “Posts” number in this gray box does indeed include your blog posts, but it also includes your discussions, comments, and other content types that you’ve posted to the community. So it’s not the figure used for the blogging set.) Instead, scroll down to the “Private Stats” section and look for “Blog Articles Posted.” That’s the number which will determine how many blogging badges you receive. Here’s an example.

In this case, this member will earn all five badges tomorrow, as his 150 posts exceed all the necessary thresholds associated with this set.

We’ll assign the badges one at a time (from lowest to highest) over the course of a few hours tomorrow, and members will get notifications for each one received – so if you’re like the member in the example above, don’t be surprised when five notifications come your way.

If you have your notifications turned off (but you’d still like to monitor your progress tomorrow), then refresh your “My content” page periodically throughout the day. Each time you get a badge, you’ll see it appear in the upper right, as well as on the page accessible from the “View all badges” link.

If you’re still waiting for your badges to show up by Thursday, September 25, please log out of SAP Community and log back in. Your badge(s) should be visible then.

Blogging is one of the most important and time-consuming activities available to members, and we’re happy to recognize our dedicated bloggers once again. If you’d like to get involved with blogging, start by taking our community tutorial and familiarize yourself with our moderation policy for blogging. We want you to earn those blogging badges – and it might be tempting to try to push through thirty posts quickly to max out the set – but you should only submit one post at a time, per article 1 of our rules of engagement. Pace yourself, do things right, and you’ll find success as a blogger (with the badges to show for it).  

By sharing their knowledge (or perhaps a little about themselves), community bloggers deliver content that educates and engages our members. This set is just a small way of thanking them. And more thanks are coming. We’ll introduce additional badges soon, so even if you aren’t a blogger, you may find yourself earning other badges for additional content type contributions in the very near future. Stay active in all areas throughout the community and see what happens. And remember: Even the simple act of leaving a kudo on content that you enjoy can bring you one step closer to a badge. Any positive action in the community, no matter how big or small, makes a huge difference, and these badges demonstrate our appreciation for your quality contributions.

entry.title: Welcome to the SAP Community Casablanca Group! 🎉
entry.content:
Hello everyone,
I’m thrilled to announce the launch of the SAP Community Group in Casablanca - a dedicated space for SAP professionals and consultants to meet, connect, exchange knowledge, and grow together.

Our vision is simple:
✅ Build a vibrant local SAP ecosystem where professionals can network, share experiences, and inspire each other.
✅ Give the SAP scene in Morocco the exposure it deserves through real, value-added events.
✅ Create a sustainable community led by professionals, for professionals.

Why join the SAP Community Casablanca Group?
Here’s what you can look forward to:
🔹 Local Meetups & Events - informal gatherings, SAP Inside Tracks, and knowledge sessions designed to bring people together.
🔹 Knowledge & Experience Sharing - blogs, discussions, and posts where you can share insights, ask questions, and learn from peers.
🔹 Networking & Growth - meet SAP experts, professionals, and leaders from across Morocco and beyond.

How you can get involved
👉 Join the Group
👉 Post your Introduction (tell us about your SAP journey, location, and interests)
👉 Stay tuned for upcoming events and discussions

This community will only be as strong as its members. By sharing your knowledge, engaging in discussions, and supporting others, you’ll help us build a solid and sustainable SAP ecosystem in Casablanca.

Together, we’re creating a place where SAP professionals can connect, exchange knowledge, and create new opportunities - while giving our local ecosystem the visibility and impact it deserves. 

I’m Younes Elmir, SAP enthusiast student and Community Event Organizer for Casablanca. I launched this group because I believe we can make a real difference by coming together, learning from each other, and showcasing Morocco’s SAP talent to the world.

We’ve already held our first SAP Community Meetup in Casablanca, and the energy was incredible - more than 20 participants, mostly consultants, all eager to collaborate and shape the future of this community.

Now it’s your turn:
💬 Introduce yourself in the comments - where are you based, what’s your SAP area, what would you like to see in this community?
📢 Share your ideas for topics, events, and activities you’d like us to organize.

Looking forward to building this journey with you all!

Younes Elmir
SAP Community Event Organizer - Casablanca

entry.title: My expert playlist, SAP TechEd, Berlin
entry.content:
PAR107 | SAP and Databricks: Real-time insights and AI without ETL 

Turn your trusted SAP data into AI-driven innovation - without the complexity of ETL. See how the SAP Business Data Cloud solution integrates with Databricks using Delta Sharing to provide more-secure, live access to SAP data for use with AI, data engineering, data warehousing, governance, and BI, and how global enterprises are accelerating value.

DA160 | SAP Business Data Cloud from set up to streamline: A practical walk-through 

Gain practical expertise in the SAP Business Data Cloud solution. Explore the solution’s core components, learn how to activate and manage them, and practice strategies to streamline data integration, governance, and access. Find out how to use SAP Business Data Cloud to simplify complex data processes and deliver scalable, trusted data solutions.

DA266 | Operationalizing AI with SAP Databricks in SAP Business Data Cloud 

The SAP Databricks capability, fully native in the SAP Business Data Cloud solution, brings scalable AI and ML to enterprise data. This session covers activating SAP Databricks, accessing and sharing governed data, building models, and running secure AI workflows—bridging data engineering and science without duplication.

DA203 | SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP Business Warehouse 

Explore best practices for modernizing your SAP Business Warehouse (SAP BW) application with the SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC) solution. Learn how to minimize migration risks, keep existing objects in SAP BW, and deliver the objects as managed data products and intelligent applications while using the latest data and AI capabilities in SAP BDC.

DA264 | SAP Business Data Cloud: Explore the analytical components end to end 

Take a hands-on journey through the analytical components of the SAP Business Data Cloud solution. Use the SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud solutions to design and build custom scenarios from beginning to end. This session is ideal for technical users seeking to transform data into meaningful business insights. 

DA205 | A deep dive into SAP as customer zero of SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC) 

Discover SAP’s journey of adopting SAP BDC and its pivotal role in SAP’s data democratization strategy with Product 360 as an internal frontrunner. Get practical tips from the integration with Databricks and SAP Business Technology Platform as the foundation for adapting, enhancing, and automating key business processes with SAP Business AI.

Not registered yet? Register now: https://www.sap.com/events/teched.html

entry.title: The Importance of Cross-Module Knowledge for SAP Consultants
entry.content:
The Importance of Cross-Module Knowledge for SAP Consultants

In today’s dynamic SAP landscape, being a consultant means much more than mastering your own module. As a functional consultant in SAP MM, I’ve learned over the years that success in real projects often depends on how well you understand the integration points with other modules.

   Why Cross-Module Knowledge Matters

End-to-End Processes: Business processes rarely stop at one module. A purchase order in MM eventually impacts FI through accounting entries, SD when linked to sales, and PP when it involves production. Without cross-module awareness, consultants risk missing critical dependencies.

Better Communication with Teams: Projects bring together FI, SD, PP, WM, and other consultants. Knowing their language and challenges helps avoid misunderstandings and ensures smoother collaboration.

Problem-Solving: Many issues reported by end users appear to be “MM problems,” but in reality, they stem from integration—such as GR/IR mismatches (MM–FI), stock discrepancies (MM–WM), or subcontracting issues (MM–PP). A consultant with cross-module knowledge can resolve issues faster.

   Key Integration Areas for MM Consultants

MM–FI: Inventory valuation, account determination, invoice verification.

MM–SD: Third-party order processing, intercompany stock transfers.

MM–PP: Material requirements planning, subcontracting, and production orders.

MM–WM/EWM: Goods receipt, stock placement, and picking processes.

    Benefits for Your Career

Stronger Profile: Recruiters and clients look for consultants who can think beyond one module.

Added Value: You become a bridge between teams, often reducing delays in projects.

Future-Readiness: In SAP S/4HANA, processes are even more integrated, making cross-module knowledge a must-have skill.

    How to Build Cross-Module Skills

Learn from your colleagues on projects—ask questions, join design workshops.

Explore integration scenarios in a training or sandbox system.

Follow SAP documentation and blogs focused on cross-functional processes.

Share knowledge within your teams and communities to reinforce your learning.

 

Final Thought: Mastering your own module is essential, but expanding into cross-module knowledge transforms you from a “consultant” into a true process expert. In the end, it’s not just about configuring SAP,it’s about understanding and optimizing business processes end to end.

entry.title: SAP Learning Hub, Student Edition
entry.content:
Маємо чудову новину — SAP Learning Hub, Student Edition тепер доступний безкоштовно для всіх студентів, які навчаються зараз, та викладачів!

У підписці ви отримаєте:

  • усі навчальні матеріали, доступні для клієнтів SAP Learning Hub,

  • 2 безкоштовні спроби складання сертифікаційних іспитів,

  • доступ до живих сесій із експертами,

  • актуальний контент для підтримання сертифікації,

  • доступ до хмарних навчальних систем.

👉Для реєстрації підготуйте свій університетський логін та студентський квиток.

  • Студенти можуть зареєструватися тут безкоштовно

  • Викладачі можуть зареєструватися тут безкоштовно

Як розпочати навчання з SAP Learning Hub?

1. Створіть свій SAP Universal ID 
Це універсальний акаунт, у якому відстежуватиметься ваш прогрес. Використовуйте університетську пошту. Якщо плануєте складати іспит, додайте ще одну (резервну) адресу.

2. Підтвердьте, що ви студент або викладач
Система перевірить ваш статус навчання. Використовуйте університетську пошту або адресу, яку університет має у своїй базі. Знадобляться логін до порталу або студентський ID.

Старі поштові адреси з минулого навчання не підійдуть.

3. Почніть навчання
Поки чекаєте на підтвердження підписки, можна ознайомитися зі Student Zone та стартувати навчання.

4. Активуйте підписку
Очікуйте листа з активаційним посиланням. Якщо його немає 3–4 дні, перевірте спам.

5. Продовжуйте навчатися
Обирайте свої learning journeys у Student Zone та рухайтеся далі.

6. Практикуйтеся на системах
Робота з реальними системами — ключ до успішної сертифікації.

7. Реєструйтеся на живі сесії
Спілкуйтеся з експертами та ставте запитання.

8. Заплануйте іспит
Коли будете готові — переходьте до сертифікації.

FAQ

❓Я вже не студент, але маю стару університетську пошту. Чи можна?
❌Ні. Реєстрація доступна лише активним студентам.

❓Скільки часу діє підписка?
✅12 місяців. Можна продовжити, якщо ви ще навчаєтеся.

❓Чи можна скласти два іспити з різних тем?
✅Так! Якщо перший скласти з першої спроби, другий можна використати для іншого іспиту.

❓З чого почати?
✅Якщо ще не визначилися з напрямком, спробуйте:

  1. Discovering SAP for Students

  2. Positioning SAP Business Suite for Students (доступно лише для студентів і викладачів після реєстрації).

🎓Бажаємо успіхів у навчанні та сертифікації!

entry.title: The strength of a community can be seen in events like SAP Inside Track Porto 2025
entry.content:
This past weekend I had the privilege of once again taking part in SAP Inside Track Porto 2025, held at the inspiring Hotel Forte de Gaia. It was a very special event, not only because of the unique atmosphere and the energy of the SAP community, but also because I had the honor of contributing in two ways: as an organizer and as a speaker.

The SAP community in Portugal keeps surprising me with the quality of knowledge shared and the spirit of collaboration that grows stronger each year. This year’s agenda struck a great balance between highly technical topics — such as innovation with CAP and AI Agents — and hands-on experiences in S/4HANA projects and SAP Cloud ERP. Each session was an opportunity to learn something new and exchange insights with colleagues and friends who, like me, believe that the real strength of the community lies in sharing real-world experiences.

In my session, I spoke about bank connectivity in SAP, presenting a project we delivered in partnership with MAKEVALUE and SIBS LABS. I demonstrated how APIs and direct integrations can simplify critical financial processes: from payments and collections to bank statements, Open Finance, and instant payments. It was very rewarding to share the results and see the audience’s interest in exploring these scenarios, which are increasingly becoming part of companies’ daily operations.

The event closed on a memorable note with live music, reminding us that technology and culture can — and should — walk hand in hand.

I left this SIT Porto 2025 with a strong sense of accomplishment, but also with renewed inspiration to keep investing in this community that grows year after year. A special thank you to all the speakers, participants, and colleagues who made this gathering possible.

And, as tradition, the positive balance of the event will be donated to a social support institution, reinforcing the idea that the SAP community is not only about technology but also about making a positive impact on society.

See you at the next SIT!

entry.title: SAP Community Hobbies series: Don't fly blind (Stress to strength: Mindful living in work & beyond)
entry.content:
Thanks to Moshe

First of all, a heartfelt thank you to  @moshenaveh , who initiated this wonderful blog series about hobbies in the SAP Community. His post “Mind your step” about walking and hiking not only inspired me, but also showed me how closely movement, nature, and inner peace are connected. Hiking and running have also been passions of mine for many years. But one special experience led me onto a new path: the path of yoga. Today I combine both movement in nature and on the yoga mat, combined with mindfulness, conscious breathing, and inner clarity.

Me on a mindful hike near Austria wearing a hat.

Who I am

My name is Achim Toeper, and I have been part of the SAP world for more than three decades. My professional journey has taken me deep into technology and leadership – but at the same time I discovered another passion: yoga and mindfulness. Since completing my yoga teacher training in 2018, these practices have become an integral part of my life. They give me energy, inspiration, and a new way of engaging with people in projects, teams, and communities. From this connection, personal projects where born, in which I combine movement, mindfulness, and leadership skills, like writing and talking about it.

My path to yoga

Some years ago, I found myself in an extremely intense professional period, marked by great responsibility and pressure. The stress kept growing – and I realized that I needed a counterbalance to avoid burning out. In this search, I came across yoga for the first time in a wellness hotel in the Allgäu – at exactly the moment when I needed it the most. This experience truly flashed me: I immediately felt that yoga is more than just movement. During those very days, I knew I wanted to dive deeper and one day become a yoga teacher myself. Step by step I learned how to regain strength through conscious breathing, movement, and meditation. Yoga gave me not only calm and balance, but also a new perspective on leadership, collaboration, and on myself.

Yoga class and ice bathing in the Ore Mountains 2014

A special moment in Copenhagen

Since that first encounter, yoga has become a constant part of my life. In 2018 I had the opportunity to bring my passion into a very special setting at the SAP Community Event in Copenhagen. At the end of my talk, I sat down cross-legged on stage while the audience remained in their seats. Behind me, an animated GIF was running in my presentation, visualizing the rhythm of box breathing:
inhale for four seconds, hold for four seconds, exhale for four seconds, hold for four seconds.
Together we followed this rhythm – and for a moment the large conference room became completely silent. Everyone was connected through the same breathing pattern. This experience was surprising for many and deeply moving for me: a moment where technology, community, and mindfulness came together in a very powerful way. 



A special honor for me on World Mental Health Day

Another highlight was October 10th 2023, the international World Mental Health Day. On this day, I was invited to lead an international yoga session for my company. People from different countries and time zones came together virtually to breathe, move, and pause for a moment. For me it was a great honor and at the same time a confirmation that mindfulness and yoga go far beyond private practice – they can build bridges, create community, and have a tangible impact in a global professional environment.

What yoga means to me

For me, yoga is far more than physical exercises. It is an attitude that shapes everyday life – both professionally and personally. It reminds me that behind every role and function there is always a human being. This perspective has changed my leadership style: away from pure control, towards more trust, calmness, and leading by example. In my company, some colleagues jokingly call me “Yoda” – a nice sign that mindfulness not only brings calm but also inspiration. For me, yoga is a compass that helps me stay clear, human, and connected even in challenging situations.

Practicing Vrksasana Yoga “Tree Pose” on a hike.

Running, swimming, and the strength of connecting with others

Back in 2000, I joined a group mainly consisting of triathletes and hockey players. That was the moment I finally started running – something I had enjoyed before but never really practiced regularly.
My last major run was in 2014 in Vienna, a city that holds a special place in my heart.

Last year – as well as this year – I completed an Olympic triathlon. Swimming has always had a calming effect on me, running grounds me in the here and now, and the combination of all three disciplines teaches me perseverance, humility, and trust in my own body.

I remember well the SAP Community Event in Copenhagen in May 2018 – that’s where I met @smarchesini .
Sebastiano is not only someone who drives SAP topics forward, but also someone who shares his passion for running with others.
I am delighted that he will be next in this hobbies series – because running connects us, and I am sure his story will bring fresh inspiration.

Photo of me taken during a race at a multi-generational run

Join the conversation

Do you do Yoga or Meditation? Share the pictures and stories behind them in the comments section. Feel free to share other hobbies you have!

If you're interested in joining the series, please reach out to Moshe Naveh via community@sap.com.

Let's get this journey going! I hope you all enjoy the great posts coming-up!

entry.title: Вебкасти Жовтня
entry.content:
SAP Вебкасти Жовтня 2025: Частина 1 🚀

Перша половина жовтня насичена безкоштовними вебкастами від SAP - AI, трансформація, data та галузеві рішення!

📅 Найближчі заходи:

1 жовтня, 15:00-19:00 🔹 Product Compliance Solution Update Demos & Customer Stories: стратегія, roadmap та панельні дискусії з EHS та Product Compliance

1 жовтня, 17:00-18:00 🔹 AI in Asset Management Як AI трансформує управління активами: intelligent insights та автоматизоване прийняття рішень

2 жовтня, 15:00-19:00 🔹 Environmental Health & Safety Solutions What's New and What's Next у EHS та Product Compliance

2 жовтня, 17:00-18:00 🔹 AI in Service Management Революція в сервісному управлінні: AI-driven оптимізація та кращий клієнтський досвід

7 жовтня, 15:00-16:00 🔹 Introduction to Clean Core Strategy Модернізація ERP-ландшафту: як зменшити складність та підготуватися до трансформації

8 жовтня, 18:00-19:00 🔹 SAP Business Data Cloud: Module 3 Create and Enrich Analytical Model with SAP Datasphere - hands-on workshop 📌 Modules 1-2 доступні on demand!

9 жовтня, 17:00-18:00 🔹 Transforming Shopping Journeys Персоналізація та AI у роздрібній торгівлі: від product recommendations до AI-powered пошуку

14 жовтня, 15:00-16:00 🔹 Achieving Clean Core: Extensibility Clean Core Level концепція: KPI, governance та вибір правильних опцій розширюваності

14 жовтня, 16:00-17:00 🔹 SAP Analytics Cloud Transforming SAP's End-to-End Planning Processes: досвід SAP IT у створенні інтегрованої платформи

14 жовтня, 17:00-18:00 🔹 SAP Service Cloud V2 - Q3/2025 Release Utilities та Enterprise Service Management: нові фічі та інтеграції

15 жовтня, 18:00-19:00 🔹 SAP Joule for Consultants AI-асистент для консультантів: як підвищити продуктивність та ефективність проєктів

*Всі години вказані за київським часом.

Якщо цей допис був корисним — ставте kudos!

Реєструйтесь вже зараз, посилання в назві вебкасту

entry.title: New Developer Forums!
entry.content:
Since the platform migration last year so many of you have asked "Where is ABAP?" and "Where are the questions about ABAP?" - we heard you loud an clear. We are therefore thrilled to finally be able to answer your questions as we are launching new Developer forums today!

 

This will be the new home for our developers and technical audience in the SAP Community, and we are starting with forums on the following topics: 

  • ABAP (classic): Everything general around ABAP, the ABAP platform or classic ABAP development. (including DDIC, ABAP List Viewer (ALV), ABAP SQL, DYNP including PBO and PAI)
  • ABAP Cloud: All ABAP Cloud related topics, including ABAP Core Data Services (CDS), ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP), and ABAP for cloud development.
  • Artificial Intelligence : AI in general, SAP Business AI, Joule, Joule Agents, Joule for Consultants, Joule for Developers or AI Foundation.
  • SAP CAP: Everything on SAP Cloud Application Programming Model. 
  • Data and Analytics:
    • SAP Business Data Cloud, including Databricks, Datasphere, Analytics Cloud and Business Warehouse.
    • SAP HANA and SAP HANA Cloud.
    • SAP Master Data Governance.
  • Frontend / UI5 / SAP Fiori: All frontend-related topics, including SAPUI5, OpenUI5 and SAP Fiori. 
  • Integration: For all SAP Integration related topics. (not limited to SAP Integration Suite)
  • Tooling, including SAP Build: For all topics related to any SAP development tool, like SAP Build Code and ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse. 

But more than just launching a home for our developer/technical audience, we are also bringing back forums as a content type, including a more compact forum feed, threaded replies and not least a filter that many of you have requested for questions with no answers. We will get into the details of the new forums below 🙂 

All developer forums consist of a hub with options both for asking questions (forum) and for publishing blog posts: 

To be able to publish content in the forums, you first need to join the group/forum, therefore please make sure you hit the "Join Group" button: 

Joining the forum also automatically triggers a subscription to new content published in the group.
You can check or change your subscriptions and notifications in your account settings here. 

Forums

As mentioned above, we are bringing back forums as a content type. 
This first iteration of the new forum feed does not contain any preview of content, thus making it easier/faster for everyone to scroll down the list to identify the questions they might have an answer to. 
The feed gives you an overview over who asked the question, when it was published, and you can also see who replied to it last (and when), if there are replies. 
We also included a filter that many of you have requested, "No answers", which shows you all questions with no interaction. This is different to "No Solutions", as the no solutions filter will give you an overview over questions with an answer, but where the author has not yet accepted one of the answers as the right solution. 
Questions with a solution can easily be identified in the feed with the green checkmark to the left of the question. The second iteration of the forum feed will make it even easier to quickly identify questions with accepted solutions in the feed. 
We also kept the icons for views, answers/replies and kudos/views in the feed. 

 

Another change with forums, compared to the Q&As, is that we are bringing back threaded replies to questions. For forums there is no difference if it is a comment asking for clarification, or if you know the answer to the question. The correct answer can be found anywhere in the threaded conversation, and the author has the option to accept any answer as the correct solution to the question. 
As you can see in the screenshot below, it is not possible to accept any reply, anywhere in the conversation as the solution: 

 

When a question has an accepted solution, it will behave the same way as the Q&As. The question will have an "Go to solution" marker on top, and the accepted answer will be displayed directly below the question with a green checkmark and a green box to identify as the correct solution:

Other than joining the group, no special permissions is needed to ask your question in the forums. Even if you are new to the SAP Community, and come here to find help, you can do so immediately after creating a new account. 
As everywhere else in the Community, please do not answer questions with AI-generated content. If you don't know the answer, please move on to the next question where you know the answer, instead of trying to build a reputation by publishing AI-generated answers that do not add any value, and in many cases also are misleading or false. 

 

Blog posts

Blog posts in the developer forums will not have a separation between SAP employees and external community users. 
Although the forums will not be curated,  we will keep a close eye on what gets published to ensure the quality of the content is according to our guidelines. Blog posts in the SAP Community should be used to share value and your personal knowledge and expertise. 
The permissions to publish blog posts will follow the rank ladder system, so if you are new to community, your blog posts will be subject to moderation review. Community users who already have permissions to publish blog posts in the "Product and Technology" categories, will be able to publish blog posts directly in the new forums, without moderation. 
You can find more information on moderation in the SAP Community in this article in our Welcome Corner group. 

The "Featured Topics" section is curated by the SAP Community team for now, and will focus on highlighting important product updates that should not be missed. 

 

Pilot-phase

The launch today is a pilot, as we want to first see how you all respond before we make a final decision on whether or not forums are here to stay. The pilot will run for 3 months, until the end of the year. 

All forums start empty, with no published content. 
The exception is the three groups which we have moved over from the Interest groups, namely "Artificial Intelligence", "Data and Analytics", and "Integration" - these three groups were moved to the new Developers area with their content. 

We will over the next months continuously improve the user experience in the forums and forum feeds, and are as always open to feedback and suggestions. 

And one last thing. We have set the "Application Development and Automation" group to read only for now, to encourage everyone to participate here instead. We will decide what to do with the group and its content once this pilot has ended. 

The SAP Developer News posts from the SAP Developer Advocate team will be published here in the meantime. 

Happy foruming everyone! 🙂 

 

Known bugs

On the main forum page, the button still says "Start a Discussion", this will be changed to "Ask a question" as soon as possible: 

 

In the mobile portrait view of the forum feed, the last filter tab may break to another line in some cases. We are aware of this, and it will be fixed in one of our upcoming releases:

entry.title: Devtoberfest 2025 - What is happening Week 1
entry.content:
Hurray! Devtoberfest 2025 just launched. Let me welcome you to a full month of education, learning, networking and fun!

To give you a better overview on what is happening each week, I will release blog posts covering activities for each week.

It can be that we will assign points and badges retroactively for this week as we are currently facing issues. No worries, all activities are being monitored!

Sessions for Week 1 (Sep 29 - Oct 3):

All sessions for Week 1 can be found in our Session Catalogue: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/eb-p/devtoberfest-events

🟢 ABAP (Monday)

  • Clean Core Extensibility Strategy Powered by ABAP Cloud and Generative AI
  • Custom code development and transformation for Clean Core in SAP S/4HANA
  • Boost Your Developer Satisfaction with SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI Capabilities

🟣 Tooling & Frontend (Tuesday)

  • Code-Along: Build a Joule Skill from Scratch with Joule Studio
  • Building Agents with Joule Studio
  • Unboxing Joule Studio: Honest Insights from Hack2Build Champions
  • Introducing Application Frontend: Simplifying UI App Hosting
  • Create a Case in Service Cloud V2 by Uploading Images Using AI Core, Build Apps

🔴Integration (Wednesday)

  • Accelerate your move to the cloud via Pipeline for Cloud Integration
  • Clean Core, Event-Driven: Unlocking SAP Value with Advanced Event Mesh
  • Designing understandable SAP BTP Solution Diagrams & contributing to the SAP Architecture Center
  • Open Resource Discovery – How to build a well-connected metadata catalog across silos

🔵Data & AI (Thursday)

  • Leveraging Calculation Views in SAP BAS: an Introduction
  • Enrich Data Products with SAP Databricks
  • Behind the Magic: How Cirque du Soleil Reimagined Invoice Management with SAP Business AI

🟠 CAP (Friday)

  • Building Enterprise Grade CAP applications using BTP Developer's guide
  • Get to know more about CAP’s documentation offering
  • Integrating S/4HANA Public Cloud APIs into CAP Made Simple

🟡 Community (Friday)

  • The New Developer Forums in the Community

Fun Activities - The Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt

In week 1, we are launching the new and challenging Scavenger Hunt! Find clues, put them together and gain a lot of points towards the Grand Prize!

For all information about the Scavenger Hunt, follow Daniel's blog post:
🟡 Fun for Week 1: The Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt 🔨🪙

Validation of your session participation

At Devtoberfest, almost every activity earns you points against the Grand Prize in our competition. This is the case for your participation in the Devtoberfest sessions for each week. Every week we release validation tutorials for the different topic tracks ABAP, Tooling & Frontend, Integration, Data & AI, CAP, and the Community sessions. The validation tutorials can be found in our Tutorial Navigator. 

It can be that we will assign points and badges retroactively for this week as we are currently facing issues. No worries, all activities are being monitored!

Head over to our tutorial page and complete the validation tutorials for earning your points!
